id: lesson-02
title: "My country is..."
duration_min: 10
xp_reward: 12
objectives:
  - State your country clearly.
  - Recognise informal vs. formal phrasing.
  - Respond politely in short exchanges.
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö", translit: "magƒì", en: "my" }
  - { si: "‡∂ª‡∂ß", translit: "ra·π≠a", en: "country" }
  - { si: "‡∑Ä‡∑í", translit: "vayi", en: "is (formal)" }
  - { si: "‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥", translit: "honda", en: "good / nice" }
  - { si: "‡∂ª‡∂ß‡∂ö‡∑ä", translit: "ra·π≠ak", en: "a country" }
  - { si: "‡∂±‡∑ô", translit: "ne", en: "isn't it? / right?" }
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: |
      To say ‚ÄúMy country is‚Ä¶‚Äù you simply say **‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂ª‡∂ß ‚Ä¶**  
      Sinhala often *drops* the verb ‚Äúis‚Äù.  
      In writing or formal speech you might see **‡∑Ä‡∑í (vayi)** added at the end.
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: ‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂ª‡∂ß ‡∑Å‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì ‡∂Ω‡∂Ç‡∂ö‡∑è‡∑Ä. ‚Äî My country is Sri Lanka.  
      B: ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥ ‡∂ª‡∂ß‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂±‡∑ô! ‚Äî That‚Äôs a nice country!  
      A: ‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑í. ‚Äî Thank you.  
      B: ‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂ª‡∂ß ‡∂¢‡∂¥‡∂±‡∑ä. ‚Äî My country is Japan.
  - type: "PRACTICE"

replit.md.content:
# BashaLanka ‚Äî Sinhala Learning App

## Overview
BashaLanka is a language learning application focused on teaching Sinhala (the primary language of Sri Lanka). The app uses a game-like, interactive approach similar to Duolingo, with various exercise types including matching pairs, translation, listening comprehension, and speaking practice.

## Project Type
Static HTML/CSS/JavaScript web application (no backend required)
- Framework-free, accessible, and mobile-first design
- Progressive Web App (PWA) capabilities with service worker
- Hash-based client-side routing

## Recent Changes (2025-10-27)
- **GitHub Import Completed**: Successfully set up BashaLanka in Replit environment
  - Installed npm dependencies (http-server)
  - Created .gitignore for Node.js and Replit files
  - Configured workflow to run on port 5000
  - Set up deployment configuration for autoscale (static site)
  - Verified app runs correctly with all features working

## Previous Changes (2025-10-27)
- **Lesson Access**: All users can now start lessons (previously admin-only)
- **Characters View**: New view with Sinhala character grid, audio playback, and practice
- **Practice Builder**: Custom practice session configurator with mode/exercise/duration selection
- **Quests System**: Daily and weekly challenges with progress tracking and rewards
- **Landing Page**: Dedicated home view for new users with hero section and feature cards
- Fixed routing to properly handle home view
- Removed undefined connectLessons() call that was causing console errors

## Initial Setup (2025-10-26)
- Initial GitHub import to Replit
- Set up Node.js development environment
- Configured http-server for local development on port 5000
- Added .gitignore for Node.js and Replit files
- Created workflow for automatic server startup

## Project Architecture

### Technology Stack
- **Frontend**: Vanilla JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, CSS3
- **Routing**: Hash-based client-side routing
- **PWA**: Service Worker (sw.js) with manifest
- **Server**: http-server (development) - static file serving only
- **Module Loading**: Dynamic ES6 imports for exercise modules

### Directory Structure
```
/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.html              # Main app shell
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ app.js                  # Core app logic, routing, UI controls
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ app.learn.js            # Learning section functionality
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ app.characters.js       # Characters view with Sinhala alphabet
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ app.practice.js         # Custom practice session builder
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ app.quests.js           # Daily/weekly quest system
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ app.home.js             # Landing page for new users
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ design-mode.js          # Debug tools (admin only)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ styles.css              # Base styles and CSS tokens
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ styles.learn.css        # Styles for learning view
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ styles.features.css     # Styles for new feature views
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ manifest.webmanifest    # PWA manifest
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ sw.js                   # Service worker
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ assets/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Lessons/            # Lesson content and exercises
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ exercises/      # Exercise type modules (JS)
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ sections/       # Course content (Markdown)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sinhala_Audio/      # Audio files for pronunciation
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ PNG/                # Image assets
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SVG/                # Vector graphics
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ data/
‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ characters.json # Character data for Characters view
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ data/                   # JSON data files for lessons/sections
```

### Key Features
1. **Multiple Exercise Types**:
   - Match Pairs
   - Translation (English ‚Üî Sinhala)
   - Picture Choice
   - Fill in the Blank
   - Listening Comprehension
   - Speaking Practice
   - Word Bank exercises
   - Dialogue practice

2. **Learning Path**:
   - Organized into Sections ‚Üí Units ‚Üí Lessons
   - All users can start lessons via "Start Lesson!!" button
   - Progress tracking via localStorage
   - Lesson simulator for testing
   - Debug tools for admins

3. **Characters Study**:
   - Grid-based character cards (vowels, consonants, common words)
   - Audio pronunciation for each character
   - Progress tracking per character
   - Practice launcher for individual characters

4. **Custom Practice Sessions**:
   - Multiple practice modes (recent mistakes, weakest skills, random, specific lesson)
   - Exercise type selection
   - Configurable session duration
   - Integrates with existing LessonSimulator

5. **Quest System**:
   - Daily quests (reset at midnight)
   - Weekly quests (reset on Sundays)
   - Progress visualization with bars
   - Reward display (XP, streaks, badges)
   - LocalStorage-based tracking

6. **Landing Page**:
   - Hero section with app branding
   - Call-to-action buttons
   - Feature showcase cards
   - Auto-redirects returning users to Learn view

7. **Accessibility**:
   - Semantic HTML
   - ARIA labels and roles
   - Keyboard navigation
   - Focus management for modals/drawers

8. **Responsive Design**:
   - Mobile-first approach
   - Sidebar drawer for navigation
   - Theme toggle (light/dark/system)

### Data Flow
- Course structure defined in `assets/Lessons/course.map.json`
- Lesson content stored in Markdown files
- Exercise data in JSON files under `/data/`
- User progress stored in localStorage
- Audio files served statically from `assets/Sinhala_Audio/`

## Development Setup

### Running Locally
The app is configured to run on port 5000 using http-server:
```bash
npm run dev
```

This starts the server on `0.0.0.0:5000` with:
- CORS enabled for development
- Cache disabled (`-c-1`) for instant updates
- Accessible from Replit webview

### Environment
- **Host**: 0.0.0.0 (required for Replit proxy)
- **Port**: 5000 (only port exposed in Replit)
- **Base Path**: Auto-detected based on hosting environment
  - Localhost/Replit: `./`
  - GitHub Pages: `/BashaLanka/`

### Configuration
The app automatically detects its environment and adjusts asset paths:
- Uses `REPO_BASE_PATH` variable for path resolution
- Supports both relative (`./`) and absolute (`/`) paths
- Works on localhost, Replit, and GitHub Pages deployments

## Deployment
The project is ready for deployment as a static site. Suitable platforms:
- Replit (current)
- GitHub Pages
- Netlify
- Vercel
- Any static hosting service

## User Preferences
None specified yet - this is the initial setup.

## Notes
- No backend required - all data is client-side
- Login is mock (localStorage only) with "admin" username for debug access
- Service worker currently has no caching strategy implemented
- All audio files are pre-recorded MP3s (fast/slowed versions)

id: lesson-01
title: "Doing Things ‚Äî ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è"
duration_min: 12
xp_reward: 15
objectives:
  - Learn the main action verb '‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è' (to do / doing).
  - Use it with pronouns to form simple present sentences.
  - Recognise that many Sinhala verbs are built with '‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è'.
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è", translit: "karanavƒÅ", en: "to do / doing" }
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∂∏", translit: "mama", en: "I" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è", translit: "oyƒÅ", en: "you" }
  - { si: "‡∂Ö‡∂¥‡∑í", translit: "api", en: "we" }
  - { si: "‡∂¥‡∑è‡∂©‡∂∏‡∑ä", translit: "pƒÅ·∏çam", en: "lesson / study" }
  - { si: "‡∂ö‡∑ë‡∂∏", translit: "k√¶ma", en: "food" }
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: |
      The verb **‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è (karanavƒÅ)** means *to do* or *doing*.  
      Sinhala forms many actions with it:
      - ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∂¥‡∑è‡∂©‡∂∏‡∑ä ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è ‚Äî I study.  
      - ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∑ë‡∂∏ ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è ‚Äî You are eating.
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: |
      üîπ Say what you‚Äôre doing:
        - ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∂ö‡∑ë‡∂∏ ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è. (I‚Äôm eating.)
        - ‡∂Ö‡∂¥‡∑í ‡∂¥‡∑è‡∂©‡∂∏‡∑ä ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è. (We study.)
      üîπ Ask:
        - ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‡∂∏‡∑ú‡∂ö‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂Ø ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è? (What are you doing?)

summary: Build everyday Sinhala confidence with greetings, introductions, origins, feelings, and polite farewells.
learning_outcomes:
  - Greet politely and ask how someone is feeling
  - Introduce yourself and ask for someone‚Äôs name
  - Talk about the country you and others are from
  - Describe how you feel and respond to wellness checks
  - Use common polite expressions for everyday comings and goings

# Section 01 ‚Äî Introductions & Essentials (Revised)

## What you‚Äôll master
- **Greetings & basics**: hello, please, sorry, yes/no, and ‚ÄúHow are you?‚Äù
- **Introduce yourself**: state your name, ask for someone else‚Äôs, and respond politely.
- **Where you‚Äôre from**: say where you live, ask others, and talk about your country.
- **Feelings & health**: check in on wellness, express happiness or sadness, and answer honestly.
- **Politeness & farewells**: wish someone good morning/night and say goodbye naturally.

## Units
- **Unit 01 ‚Äî Greetings & Basics**
  Learn the essential opening moves: greet formally, ask how someone is, and respond with thanks, please, or sorry.

- **Unit 02 ‚Äî Introducing Yourself**
  Use possessives to state your name, ask for someone else‚Äôs, and share polite ‚Äúnice to meet you‚Äù exchanges.

- **Unit 03 ‚Äî Where You're From**
  Combine country words with "from" and ask where someone comes from, including reusable {country} prompts.

- **Unit 04 ‚Äî Feelings & Health**
  Practice wellness check questions, positive/negative answers, and vocabulary for happy or sad moods.

- **Unit 05 ‚Äî Politeness & Farewells**
  Wrap conversations with good morning/night wishes and casual or formal goodbyes.

id: lesson-01
title: "Possessives (g√©) ‚Äî My / Your / Their"
duration_min: 8
xp_reward: 10
objectives:
  - Use the possessive marker **‡∂ú‡∑ö (g√©)** for people and animals
  - Learn the exception **‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö (magƒì)** for ‚Äúmy‚Äù
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö", translit: "magƒì", en: "my (exception)" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö", translit: "oyƒÅgƒì", en: "your (informal)" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∂‡∂ú‡∑ö", translit: "obagƒì", en: "your (formal)" }
  - { si: "‡∂í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö", translit: "eyƒÅgƒì", en: "their / his / her (neutral)" }
  - { si: "‡∂±‡∂∏", translit: "nama", en: "name" }
  - { si: "‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω‡∑î‡∑Ä‡∑è", translit: "yƒÅluwƒÅ", en: "friend" }
pronunciation_tips: |
  ‡∂ú‡∑ö = g√© ‚Äî soft ‚Äúgeh‚Äù.
  Note: 1st-person uses ‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö (magƒì), not **mamagƒì**.
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: "Attach **‡∂ú‡∑ö** after a pronoun to show possession. **‡∂í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö** covers 'his', 'her', or 'their' depending on context."
  - type: "MINI_EXAMPLE"
    body: |
      ‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂±‡∂∏ ‚Äî magƒì nama ‚Äî my name  
      ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω‡∑î‡∑Ä‡∑è ‚Äî oyƒÅgƒì yƒÅluwƒÅ ‚Äî your friend  
      ‡∂í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂±‡∂∏ ‚Äî eyƒÅgƒì nama ‚Äî their name
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: "Say aloud: my friend, your name, their friend. Swap pronouns each time."
unlock_next: "lesson-02"

id: lesson-01
title: "What is your country?"
duration_min: 10
xp_reward: 12
objectives:
  - Ask what someone‚Äôs country is.
  - Practise naming countries in Sinhala.
  - Understand question particle ‚Äú‡∂Ø?‚Äù.
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∂ª‡∂ß", translit: "ra·π≠a", en: "country" }
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∑ú‡∂ö‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂Ø", translit: "mokakda", en: "what?" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö", translit: "oyƒÅgƒì", en: "your" }
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö", translit: "magƒì", en: "my" }
  - { si: "‡∑Å‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì ‡∂Ω‡∂Ç‡∂ö‡∑è‡∑Ä", translit: "Sri LankƒÅva", en: "Sri Lanka" }
  - { si: "‡∂ï‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂ß‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ö‡∂Ω‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∑Ä", translit: "≈åstrƒìliyƒÅva", en: "Australia" }
  - { si: "‡∂â‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂Ø‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∑Ä", translit: "IndiyƒÅva", en: "India" }
  - { si: "‡∂á‡∂∏‡∑ô‡∂ª‡∑í‡∂ö‡∑è‡∑Ä", translit: "AmerikƒÅva", en: "America" }
  - { si: "‡∂¢‡∂¥‡∂±‡∑ä", translit: "Japan", en: "Japan" }
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: |
      ‚ÄúWhat is your country?‚Äù in Sinhala is **‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂ª‡∂ß ‡∂∏‡∑ú‡∂ö‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂Ø?**  
      - **‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö (oyƒÅgƒì)** = your  
      - **‡∂ª‡∂ß (ra·π≠a)** = country  
      - **‡∂∏‡∑ú‡∂ö‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂Ø? (mokakda?)** = what?  
      The **‡∂Ø (da)** at the end marks a question.
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂ª‡∂ß ‡∂∏‡∑ú‡∂ö‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂Ø? ‚Äî What is your country?  
      B: ‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂ª‡∂ß ‡∑Å‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì ‡∂Ω‡∂Ç‡∂ö‡∑è‡∑Ä. ‚Äî My country is Sri Lanka.  
      A: ‡∂î‡∑Ä‡∑ä, ‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂ª‡∂ß ‡∂î‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂ß‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ö‡∂Ω‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∑Ä. ‚Äî Yes, my country is Australia.  
      C: ‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂ª‡∂ß ‡∂â‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂Ø‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∑Ä. ‚Äî My country is India.
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: |
      Replace ‚ÄúSri Lanka‚Äù with another country each time you practise.  
      Try saying it with a friend!

id: lesson-03
title: "Ask Names ‚Äî What is your name?"
duration_min: 8
xp_reward: 12
objectives:
  - Ask **‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂±‡∂∏ ‡∂∏‡∑ú‡∂ö‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂Ø?** (informal)
  - Ask **‡∂î‡∂∂‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂±‡∂∏ ‡∂∏‡∑ú‡∂ö‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂Ø?** (formal)
  - Use **‡∂∏‡∑ú‡∂ö‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂Ø** for ‚Äúwhat?‚Äù
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∑ú‡∂ö‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂Ø", translit: "mokakda", en: "what?" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂±‡∂∏ ‡∂∏‡∑ú‡∂ö‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂Ø?", translit: "oyƒÅgƒì nama mokakda?", en: "What is your name? (informal)" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∂‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂±‡∂∏ ‡∂∏‡∑ú‡∂ö‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂Ø?", translit: "obagƒì nama mokakda?", en: "What is your name? (formal)" }
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂±‡∂∏ [name]", translit: "magƒì nama [name]", en: "My name is [name]" }
  - { si: "‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑í", translit: "sthuthiyi", en: "thank you" }
pronunciation_tips: |
  ‡∂∏‡∑ú‡∂ö‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂Ø = mo-kak-da (quick middle syllable).  
  Keep tone flat, not rising.
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: "Question pattern: **[your] name what?** There‚Äôs no separate word for 'is'."
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: ‡∂î‡∂∂‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂±‡∂∏ ‡∂∏‡∑ú‡∂ö‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂Ø? ‚Äî obagƒì nama mokakda? ‚Äî What‚Äôs your name?  
      B: ‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂±‡∂∏ ‡∂ª‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑è. ‚Äî magƒì nama Riya. ‚Äî My name is Riya.  
      A: ‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑í. ‚Äî sthuthiyi. ‚Äî Thank you.
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: "Ask three people their names formally and informally. End each reply with '‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑í'."

id: lesson-05
title: "Saying Words ‚Äî How do you say it?"
duration_min: 12
xp_reward: 20
objectives:
  - Use '‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è' to say or tell.
  - Ask how to say something in Sinhala or English.
  - Distinguish between '‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è' and '‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±‡∑ö'.
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è", translit: "kiyanavƒÅ", en: "to say / tell" }
  - { si: "‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±‡∑ö", translit: "kiyannƒì", en: "is saying / called" }
  - { si: "‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø", translit: "kohomada", en: "how?" }
  - { si: "‡∑É‡∑í‡∂Ç‡∑Ñ‡∂Ω‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä", translit: "si·πÅhalen", en: "in Sinhala" }
  - { si: "‡∂â‡∂Ç‡∂ú‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì‡∑É‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä", translit: "ingrƒ´siyen", en: "in English" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è", translit: "oyƒÅ", en: "you" }
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: |
      To **say** something ‚Üí **‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è (kiyanavƒÅ)**  
      To ask *how something is said* ‚Üí **‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±‡∑ö (kiyannƒì)** + **‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø (kohomada)**

      Example:
      - ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è. ‚Üí I say.  
      - ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±‡∑ö ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø? ‚Üí How do you say (it)?
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: "Hello" ‡∑É‡∑í‡∂Ç‡∑Ñ‡∂Ω‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±‡∑ö ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø?  
         ‚Äî How do you say ‚ÄúHello‚Äù in Sinhala?  
      B: ‡∂Ö‡∂∫‡∑î‡∂∂‡∑ù‡∑Ä‡∂±‡∑ä ‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è.  
         ‚Äî We say ‚ÄúAyubowan.‚Äù
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: |
      üîπ Ask and answer:
        - "Good morning" ‡∑É‡∑í‡∂Ç‡∑Ñ‡∂Ω‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±‡∑ö ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø?
        - ‡∑É‡∑î‡∂∑ ‡∂ã‡∂Ø‡∑ö‡∂ö‡∑ä ‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è.
      üîπ Try the reverse:
        - ‚Äú‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑í‚Äù ‡∂â‡∂Ç‡∂ú‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì‡∑É‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä ‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±‡∑ö ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø?  
          ‚Äî It‚Äôs said ‚ÄúThank you.‚Äù
unlock_next: null

id: lesson-03
title: "I am from..."
duration_min: 11
xp_reward: 13
objectives:
  - Use ‚Äú‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä (en)‚Äù to show origin.
  - Say ‚ÄúI am from‚Ä¶‚Äù and ‚ÄúWhere are you from?‚Äù
  - Build two-way dialogue fluency.
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∂∏", translit: "mama", en: "I / me" }
  - { si: "‡∂ú‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä", translit: "gen", en: "from" }
  - { si: "‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂Ø?", translit: "kohenda?", en: "from where?" }
  - { si: "‡∑Å‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì ‡∂Ω‡∂Ç‡∂ö‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä", translit: "Sri LankƒÅven", en: "from Sri Lanka" }
  - { si: "‡∂ï‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂ß‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ö‡∂Ω‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä", translit: "≈åstrƒìliyƒÅven", en: "from Australia" }
  - { si: "‡∂â‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂Ø‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä", translit: "IndiyƒÅven", en: "from India" }
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: |
      To show where someone is from, Sinhala uses **‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä (en)** or **‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä (ven)** after the country.  
      Example:  
      - ‡∑Å‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì ‡∂Ω‡∂Ç‡∂ö‡∑è‡∑Ä + ‡∂ë‡∂±‡∑ä ‚Üí ‡∑Å‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì ‡∂Ω‡∂Ç‡∂ö‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä = from Sri Lanka
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂Ø? ‚Äî Where are you from?  
      B: ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑Å‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì ‡∂Ω‡∂Ç‡∂ö‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä. ‚Äî I‚Äôm from Sri Lanka.  
      A: ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∂î‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂ß‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ö‡∂Ω‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä. ‚Äî I‚Äôm from Australia.  
      B: ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂∫‡∑í! ‚Äî Nice!
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: |
      Swap countries in the dialogue.  
      Ask friends ‚Äú‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂Ø?‚Äù and answer with your own origin.

README.md.content:
# BashaLanka ‚Äî Starter

Minimal scaffold for the BashaLanka Sinhala learning app.

## Run locally
Use any static server (hash routing works):
- Python: `python3 -m http.server 8080`
- Node: `npx serve .`

Then open: `http://localhost:8080/#/home`

## Structure
- `index.html` ‚Äî shell
- `styles.css` ‚Äî base styles + tokens
- `app.js` ‚Äî minimal router + Home / lesson stub
- `data/course.index.json` ‚Äî Section 1 preview
- `assets/` ‚Äî logo + PWA icons
- `manifest.webmanifest` ‚Äî PWA manifest
- `sw.js` ‚Äî service worker (no caching yet)

## Next steps
- Implement lesson renderer at `#/lesson/:id`
- Add schema + real lessons in `data/`
- Cache shell & data in `sw.js` for offline

## Section assets
- Each course section lives in its own folder inside this directory.
- Create a folder named `section-N` with a `units.json` file and any
- supporting art or overrides to add a new section to the learn page.

assets/Lessons/sections/section-01-intro.content:
---
id: unit-01
title: Greetings & Basics
overview: Master core greetings, yes/no responses, and polite words like please and sorry to open any conversation smoothly.
goals:
  - Say ‡∂Ü‡∂∫‡∑î‡∂∂‡∑ù‡∑Ä‡∂±‡∑ä (ƒÅyub≈çvan) and ask ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø? (kohomada?)
  - Reply that you are fine and thank someone politely
  - Give quick yes/no answers with ‡∂î‡∑Ä‡∑ä (owu) and ‡∂±‡∑ë (nae)
  - Use ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∑î‡∂´‡∑è‡∂ö‡∂ª (karu·πáƒÅkara) and ‡∑É‡∂∏‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂± (samƒÅvenna) for requests and apologies
prerequisites: []
lessons: [lesson-01, lesson-02, lesson-03]
assessment: Mini dialogue: greet ‚Üí ask ‚ÄúHow are you?‚Äù ‚Üí reply with thanks and a polite word.
---

# Unit 01 Overview

- **Lesson 01** ‚Äî Hello! Learn ‡∂Ü‡∂∫‡∑î‡∂∂‡∑ù‡∑Ä‡∂±‡∑ä, how to ask how someone is, and hear it back.
- **Lesson 02** ‚Äî Answer politely: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm fine, thank you‚Äù plus yes/no shortcuts.
- **Lesson 03** ‚Äî Add please and sorry so you can make requests and excuse yourself.

---
id: unit-03
title: Where You're From
overview: Talk about countries, say where you‚Äôre from, and ask others politely about their origin.
goals:
  - Use ‡∂ª‡∂ß (ra·π≠a) and ‡∂ú‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä (gen) to describe where you come from
  - Say ‚ÄúI am from ‚Ä¶‚Äù and ‚ÄúMy country is ‚Ä¶‚Äù with country words
  - Ask ‚ÄúWhere are you from?‚Äù using ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂Ø? (kohenda?)
  - Swap in learner profile or lesson countries with {country}
  - Recycle yes/no replies to confirm places politely
prerequisites: [unit-02]
lessons: [lesson-01, lesson-02, lesson-03, lesson-04]
assessment: Mini dialogue: ‚ÄúI am from Sri Lanka‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúWhere are you from?‚Äù ‚Üí reply with your country.
---

# Unit 03 Overview

- **Lesson 01** ‚Äî Country words and ‚ÄúMy country is ‚Ä¶‚Äù.
- **Lesson 02** ‚Äî ‚ÄúI am from ‚Ä¶‚Äù using ‡∂ú‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä constructions.
- **Lesson 03** ‚Äî Ask ‚ÄúWhere are you from?‚Äù and understand answers.
- **Lesson 04** ‚Äî Practice with {country} swaps and polite confirmations.

id: lesson-03
title: "Speaking Languages"
duration_min: 13
xp_reward: 18
objectives:
  - Say what languages you speak.
  - Use '‡∂ö‡∂≠‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è' with language names.
  - Learn new language vocabulary.
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∑É‡∑í‡∂Ç‡∑Ñ‡∂Ω", translit: "si·πÅhala", en: "Sinhala" }
  - { si: "‡∂â‡∂Ç‡∂ú‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì‡∑É‡∑í", translit: "ingrƒ´si", en: "English" }
  - { si: "‡∂≠‡∑è‡∂∏‡∑í‡∂Ω‡∑ä", translit: "tƒÅmil", en: "Tamil" }
  - { si: "‡∂†‡∂∫‡∑í‡∂±‡∑í‡∑É‡∑ä", translit: "chainƒ´s", en: "Chinese" }
  - { si: "‡∂Ö‡∂¥‡∑í", translit: "api", en: "we" }
  - { si: "‡∂ö‡∂≠‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è", translit: "kathƒÅ karanavƒÅ", en: "to speak / to talk" }
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: |
      To say you speak a language:
      - ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑É‡∑í‡∂Ç‡∑Ñ‡∂Ω ‡∂ö‡∂≠‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è. ‚Äî I speak Sinhala.
      - ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‡∂â‡∂Ç‡∂ú‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì‡∑É‡∑í ‡∂ö‡∂≠‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è‡∂Ø? ‚Äî Do you speak English?
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: |
      üîπ Build more:
        - ‡∂Ö‡∂¥‡∑í ‡∂≠‡∑è‡∂∏‡∑í‡∂Ω‡∑ä ‡∂ö‡∂≠‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è. (We speak Tamil.)
        - ‡∂î‡∑Ñ‡∑î ‡∂†‡∂∫‡∑í‡∂±‡∑í‡∑É‡∑ä ‡∂ö‡∂≠‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è. (He speaks Chinese.)
unlock_next: "lesson-04"

id: lesson-04
title: "Are you from Sri Lanka?"
duration_min: 12
xp_reward: 14
objectives:
  - Form yes/no questions using ‚Äú‡∂Ø?‚Äù.
  - Answer positively or negatively.
  - Use ‚Äú‡∂±‡∑ô‡∑Ä‡∑ö (nevƒì)‚Äù for negation.
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∂Ø?", translit: "da?", en: "question particle" }
  - { si: "‡∂±‡∑ô‡∑Ä‡∑ö", translit: "nevƒì", en: "not / isn‚Äôt" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∑Ä‡∑ä", translit: "owu", en: "yes" }
  - { si: "‡∂±‡∑ë", translit: "n√¶", en: "no" }
  - { si: "‡∂í‡∂≠‡∑ä", translit: "ƒìth", en: "but" }
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: |
      Add **‡∂Ø? (da?)** to make a yes/no question.  
      Example: ‚Äú‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑Å‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì ‡∂Ω‡∂Ç‡∂ö‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä.‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äú‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‡∑Å‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì ‡∂Ω‡∂Ç‡∂ö‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä ‡∂Ø?‚Äù (Are you from Sri Lanka?)  
      Use **‡∂±‡∑ô‡∑Ä‡∑ö (nevƒì)** for ‚Äúnot‚Äù.
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‡∑Å‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì ‡∂Ω‡∂Ç‡∂ö‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä ‡∂Ø? ‚Äî Are you from Sri Lanka?  
      B: ‡∂î‡∑Ä‡∑ä, ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑Å‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì ‡∂Ω‡∂Ç‡∂ö‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä. ‚Äî Yes, I‚Äôm from Sri Lanka.  
      A: ‡∂±‡∑ë, ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∂â‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂Ø‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä ‡∂±‡∑ô‡∑Ä‡∑ö. ‚Äî No, I‚Äôm not from India.  
      B: ‡∂í‡∂≠‡∑ä ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∂î‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂ß‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ö‡∂Ω‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä. ‚Äî But I‚Äôm from Australia.
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: |
      Turn any statement into a question by adding **‡∂Ø?**  
      Practise both ‚Äú‡∂î‡∑Ä‡∑ä‚Äù and ‚Äú‡∂±‡∑ë‚Äù answers aloud.
unlock_next: "lesson-05"

id: lesson-01
title: "Pronouns + Yes/No Basics"
duration_min: 8
xp_reward: 10
objectives:
  - Learn pronouns for I / you / they
  - Use yes / no in short replies
  - Say ‚Äúfine / good‚Äù
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∂∏", translit: "mama", en: "I" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è", translit: "oyƒÅ", en: "you (casual)" }
  - { si: "‡∂í‡∂∫‡∑è", translit: "eyƒÅ", en: "they / he / she (neutral)" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∑Ä‡∑ä", translit: "owu", en: "yes" }
  - { si: "‡∂±‡∑ë", translit: "nae", en: "no" }
  - { si: "‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂∫‡∑í", translit: "hondayi", en: "fine / good" }
pronunciation_tips: |
  ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂∫‡∑í = hon-dai (soft ‚Äòh‚Äô).  
  ‡∂î‡∑Ä‡∑ä = o-woo (short ‚Äòo‚Äô).  
  ‡∂±‡∑ë = flat ‚Äòae‚Äô as in ‚Äúcat‚Äù.
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: "Sinhala replies often skip verbs. Just use pronoun + ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂∫‡∑í."
  - type: "MINI_EXAMPLE"
    body: |
      ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂∫‡∑í ‚Äî mama hondayi ‚Äî I‚Äôm fine  
      ‡∂î‡∑Ä‡∑ä ‚Äî owu ‚Äî yes

id: lesson-02
title: "Possessives (Plural & Formal)"
duration_min: 12
xp_reward: 14
objectives:
  - Use plural possessive forms (our, your, their).
  - Practise with familiar nouns.
  - Identify the exception word ‚Äú‡∂Ö‡∂¥‡∑ö‚Äù.
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∂Ö‡∂¥‡∑ö", translit: "apƒì", en: "our" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω‡∂ú‡∑ö", translit: "oyƒÅlagƒì", en: "your (plural)" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∂‡∂Ω‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö", translit: "obalƒÅgƒì", en: "your (formal plural)" }
  - { si: "‡∂í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω‡∂ú‡∑ö", translit: "eyƒÅlagƒì", en: "their" }
  - { si: "‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω‡∑î‡∑Ä‡∑è", translit: "yƒÅluwƒÅ", en: "friend" }
  - { si: "‡∂ú‡∑ô‡∂Ø‡∂ª", translit: "gedara", en: "house / home" }
  - { si: "‡∂¥‡∑ú‡∂≠", translit: "potha", en: "book" }
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: |
      To show possession, add **-‡∂ú‡∑ö (g√©)** to the pronoun.  
      Example: ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‚Üí ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö = your  
      Exception: **‡∂Ö‡∂¥‡∑ö** (our) doesn‚Äôt take -g√©.
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: ‡∂∏‡∑ô‡∂ö ‡∂Ö‡∂¥‡∑ö ‡∂¥‡∑ú‡∂≠. ‚Äî This is our book.  
      B: ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂ú‡∑ô‡∂Ø‡∂ª ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ö‡∂Ø? ‚Äî Where is your house?  
      A: ‡∂Ö‡∂¥‡∑ö ‡∂ú‡∑ô‡∂Ø‡∂ª ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ö‡∂π. ‚Äî Our home is in Colombo.  
      B: ‡∂í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω‡∑î‡∑Ä‡∑è ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂∫‡∑í. ‚Äî Their friend is nice.
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: |
      Create your own short sentences:
      - ‡∂Ö‡∂¥‡∑ö + [object]  
      - ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω‡∂ú‡∑ö + [object]  
      - ‡∂í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω‡∂ú‡∑ö + [object]
      Use real words like ‡∂ú‡∑ô‡∂Ø‡∂ª (house) or ‡∂¥‡∑ú‡∂≠ (book).

id: lesson-03
title: "How Old Are You?"

xp_reward: 15
objectives:
  - Ask about someone‚Äôs age.
  - Learn numbers 10‚Äì40.
  - Practise polite small talk.
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∑É", translit: "vayasa", en: "age" }
  - { si: "‡∂ö‡∑ì‡∂∫‡∂Ø", translit: "kiyada", en: "how much / how many" }
  - { si: "‡∂Ø‡∑Ñ‡∂∫", translit: "dahaya", en: "ten" }
  - { si: "‡∑Ä‡∑í‡∑É‡∑ä‡∑É", translit: "vissa", en: "twenty" }
  - { si: "‡∂≠‡∑í‡∑Ñ", translit: "thiha", en: "thirty" }
  - { si: "‡∑Ñ‡∂≠‡∂Ω‡∑í‡∑Ñ", translit: "hataliha", en: "forty" }
  - { si: "‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∑É‡∂∫‡∑í", translit: "vayasayi", en: "has age (used in speech)" }
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: |
      ‚ÄúHow old are you?‚Äù ‚Üí **‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∑É ‡∂ö‡∑ì‡∂∫‡∂Ø?**  
      - Use **‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∑É (vayasa)** = age  
      - **‡∂ö‡∑ì‡∂∫‡∂Ø (kiyada)** = how much / how many  
      Sinhala doesn‚Äôt add ‚Äúyears old‚Äù ‚Äî it‚Äôs understood.
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∑É ‡∂ö‡∑ì‡∂∫‡∂Ø? ‚Äî How old are you?  
      B: ‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∑É ‡∑Ä‡∑í‡∑É‡∑ä‡∑É‡∂∫‡∑í. ‚Äî I‚Äôm twenty.  
      A: ‡∂î‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø? ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∂≠‡∑í‡∑Ñ‡∂∫‡∑í! ‚Äî Really? I‚Äôm thirty!  
      B: ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂∫‡∑í ‡∂±‡∑ö‡∂Ø? ‚Äî Nice, right?
  - type: "PRACTICE"

      Ask and answer:

      Practise using 10 (‡∂Ø‡∑Ñ‡∂∫), 20 (‡∑Ä‡∑í‡∑É‡∑ä‡∑É), 30 (‡∂≠‡∑í‡∑Ñ), 40 (‡∑Ñ‡∂≠‡∂Ω‡∑í‡∑Ñ).

id: lesson-01
title: "More Pronouns ‚Äî We, They, You (Plural)"
duration_min: 11
xp_reward: 13
objectives:
  - Learn Sinhala plural and formal pronouns.
  - Practise using them in natural sentences.
  - Distinguish between casual and polite tone.
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∂Ö‡∂¥‡∑í", translit: "api", en: "we / us" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω", translit: "oyƒÅla", en: "you (plural)" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∂‡∂Ω‡∑è", translit: "obalƒÅ", en: "you (formal plural)" }
  - { si: "‡∂í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω‡∑è", translit: "eyƒÅlƒÅ", en: "they" }
  - { si: "‡∂Ö‡∂¥‡∑í‡∂ß", translit: "apita", en: "to us" }
  - { si: "‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂∫‡∑í", translit: "hondayi", en: "good / fine" }
  - { si: "‡∑É‡∂±‡∑ì‡∂¥‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä", translit: "sanƒ´pen", en: "well / healthy" }
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: |
      Sinhala uses **-‡∂Ω‡∑è (lƒÅ)** to make pronouns plural.  
      - ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‚Üí ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω = you all  
      - ‡∂í‡∂∫‡∑è ‚Üí ‡∂í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω‡∑è = they  
      Formal plural uses **‡∂î‡∂∂‡∂Ω‡∑è (obalƒÅ)** ‚Äî polite and respectful.
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂Ø? ‚Äî Are you all well?  
      B: ‡∂î‡∑Ä‡∑ä, ‡∂Ö‡∂¥‡∑í ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂∫‡∑í! ‚Äî Yes, we‚Äôre fine!  
      A: ‡∂í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂Ø? ‚Äî Where are they from?  
      B: ‡∂í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω ‡∑Å‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì ‡∂Ω‡∂Ç‡∂ö‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä. ‚Äî They‚Äôre from Sri Lanka.
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: |
      Swap pronouns in each line:
      - ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‚Üí ‡∂Ö‡∂¥‡∑í  
      - ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‚Üí ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω  
      - ‡∂í‡∂∫‡∑è ‚Üí ‡∂í‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂Ω‡∑è  
      Practise saying them in short sentences aloud.
unlock_next: "lesson-02"

id: lesson-03
title: "How Old Are You?"
duration_min: 12
xp_reward: 15
objectives:
  - Ask about someone‚Äôs age.
  - Learn numbers 10‚Äì40.
  - Practise polite small talk.
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∑É", translit: "vayasa", en: "age" }
  - { si: "‡∂ö‡∑ì‡∂∫‡∂Ø", translit: "kiyada", en: "how much / how many" }
  - { si: "‡∂Ø‡∑Ñ‡∂∫", translit: "dahaya", en: "ten" }
  - { si: "‡∑Ä‡∑í‡∑É‡∑ä‡∑É", translit: "vissa", en: "twenty" }
  - { si: "‡∂≠‡∑í‡∑Ñ", translit: "thiha", en: "thirty" }
  - { si: "‡∑Ñ‡∂≠‡∂Ω‡∑í‡∑Ñ", translit: "hataliha", en: "forty" }
  - { si: "‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∑É‡∂∫‡∑í", translit: "vayasayi", en: "has age (used in speech)" }
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: |
      ‚ÄúHow old are you?‚Äù ‚Üí **‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∑É ‡∂ö‡∑ì‡∂∫‡∂Ø?**  
      - Use **‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∑É (vayasa)** = age  
      - **‡∂ö‡∑ì‡∂∫‡∂Ø (kiyada)** = how much / how many  
      Sinhala doesn‚Äôt add ‚Äúyears old‚Äù ‚Äî it‚Äôs understood.
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∑É ‡∂ö‡∑ì‡∂∫‡∂Ø? ‚Äî How old are you?  
      B: ‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∑É ‡∑Ä‡∑í‡∑É‡∑ä‡∑É‡∂∫‡∑í. ‚Äî I‚Äôm twenty.  
      A: ‡∂î‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø? ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∂≠‡∑í‡∑Ñ‡∂∫‡∑í! ‚Äî Really? I‚Äôm thirty!  
      B: ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂∫‡∑í ‡∂±‡∑ö‡∂Ø? ‚Äî Nice, right?
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: |
      Ask and answer:
      - ‚Äú‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∑É ‡∂ö‡∑ì‡∂∫‡∂Ø?‚Äù  
      - ‚Äú‡∂∏‡∂ú‡∑ö ‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∑É [number]‡∂∫‡∑í.‚Äù  
      Practise using 10 (‡∂Ø‡∑Ñ‡∂∫), 20 (‡∑Ä‡∑í‡∑É‡∑ä‡∑É), 30 (‡∂≠‡∑í‡∑Ñ), 40 (‡∑Ñ‡∂≠‡∂Ω‡∑í‡∑Ñ).
unlock_next: "lesson-04"

assets/Lessons/sections/section-01-intro.content:
id: lesson-04
title: "Do you speak...? / I don‚Äôt speak..."
duration_min: 13
xp_reward: 18
objectives:
  - Ask if someone speaks a language.
  - Use '‡∂Ø?' for yes/no questions.
  - Learn to negate with '‡∂±‡∑ê‡∑Ñ‡∑ê'.
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∂Ø?", translit: "da?", en: "question particle" }
  - { si: "‡∂±‡∑ê‡∑Ñ‡∑ê", translit: "n√¶h√¶", en: "not / no" }
  - { si: "‡∂ö‡∂≠‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è", translit: "kathƒÅ karanavƒÅ", en: "to speak / to talk" }
  - { si: "‡∑É‡∑í‡∂Ç‡∑Ñ‡∂Ω", translit: "si·πÅhala", en: "Sinhala" }
  - { si: "‡∂â‡∂Ç‡∂ú‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì‡∑É‡∑í", translit: "ingrƒ´si", en: "English" }
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∂∏", translit: "mama", en: "I" }
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: |
      Add **‡∂Ø? (da?)** to make a question:  
      - ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‡∑É‡∑í‡∂Ç‡∑Ñ‡∂Ω ‡∂ö‡∂≠‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è‡∂Ø? ‚Äî Do you speak Sinhala?

      Use **‡∂±‡∑ê‡∑Ñ‡∑ê (n√¶h√¶)** for negation:  
      - ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑É‡∑í‡∂Ç‡∑Ñ‡∂Ω ‡∂ö‡∂≠‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è ‡∂±‡∑ê‡∑Ñ‡∑ê. ‚Äî I don‚Äôt speak Sinhala.
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‡∂â‡∂Ç‡∂ú‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì‡∑É‡∑í ‡∂ö‡∂≠‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è‡∂Ø?  
      B: ‡∂î‡∑Ä‡∑ä, ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∂â‡∂Ç‡∂ú‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì‡∑É‡∑í ‡∂ö‡∂≠‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è.  
      A: ‡∑É‡∑í‡∂Ç‡∑Ñ‡∂Ω ‡∂ö‡∂≠‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è‡∂Ø?  
      B: ‡∂±‡∑ë, ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑É‡∑í‡∂Ç‡∑Ñ‡∂Ω ‡∂ö‡∂≠‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è ‡∂±‡∑ê‡∑Ñ‡∑ê.
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: |
      üîπ Ask and answer with '‡∂Ø?' and '‡∂±‡∑ê‡∑Ñ‡∑ê':
        - ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è ‡∂≠‡∑è‡∂∏‡∑í‡∂Ω‡∑ä ‡∂ö‡∂≠‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è‡∂Ø?
        - ‡∂î‡∑Ä‡∑ä / ‡∂±‡∑ë
unlock_next: "lesson-05"

id: lesson-03
title: "Formal Greeting & First Conversation"
duration_min: 11
xp_reward: 13
objectives:
  - Use **‡∂Ü‡∂∫‡∑î‡∂∂‡∑ù‡∑Ä‡∂±‡∑ä** formally
  - Ask and reply politely
  - Keep a short natural dialogue going
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∂Ü‡∂∫‡∑î‡∂∂‡∑ù‡∑Ä‡∂±‡∑ä", translit: "ƒÅyub≈çvan", en: "hello / formal greeting" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∂‡∂ß ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø?", translit: "obata kohomada?", en: "How are you? (formal)" }
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∑í‡∂±‡∑ä ‡∂â‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è", translit: "mama hondin innavƒÅ", en: "I‚Äôm doing well" }
  - { si: "‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑í", translit: "sthuthiyi", en: "thank you" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∂‡∂ß‡∂≠‡∑ä", translit: "obatat", en: "to you too" }
pronunciation_tips: |
  ‡∂Ü‡∂∫‡∑î‡∂∂‡∑ù‡∑Ä‡∂±‡∑ä = ƒÅ-yu-b≈ç-van (steady rhythm).  
  Use with slight bow or hand gesture ‚Äî shows respect.
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: "Formal settings use **‡∂Ü‡∂∫‡∑î‡∂∂‡∑ù‡∑Ä‡∂±‡∑ä** and **‡∂î‡∂∂‡∂ß ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø?** instead of casual forms.  
           Add **‡∂î‡∂∂‡∂ß‡∂≠‡∑ä** to say 'to you too'."
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: ‡∂Ü‡∂∫‡∑î‡∂∂‡∑ù‡∑Ä‡∂±‡∑ä! ‡∂î‡∂∂‡∂ß ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø? ‚Äî Hello! How are you?  
      B: ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∑í‡∂±‡∑ä ‡∂â‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±‡∑Ä‡∑è, ‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑í. ‚Äî I‚Äôm doing well, thank you.  
      A: ‡∂∏‡∂ß‡∂≠‡∑ä ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂∫‡∑í! ‡∂î‡∂∂‡∂ß‡∂≠‡∑ä ‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑í! ‚Äî I‚Äôm good too, thanks to you too.
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: "Read aloud the full conversation. Swap A/B and repeat. Add gestures for realism."
unlock_next: "lesson-04"

id: lesson-04
title: "Politeness & Everyday Expressions"
duration_min: 12
xp_reward: 14
objectives:
  - Use **‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑í**, **‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∑î‡∂´‡∑è‡∂ö‡∂ª**, **‡∑É‡∂∏‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±** naturally
  - Understand polite tone and when to use each
  - Combine them with greetings and replies
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑í", translit: "sthuthiyi", en: "thank you" }
  - { si: "‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∑î‡∂´‡∑è‡∂ö‡∂ª", translit: "karunƒÅkar", en: "please" }
  - { si: "‡∑É‡∂∏‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±", translit: "samƒÅvenna", en: "sorry / excuse me" }
  - { si: "‡∂í‡∂ö‡∂ß ‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑í", translit: "ekata sthuthiyi", en: "thank you for that" }
  - { si: "‡∂á‡∂≠‡∑î‡∑Ö‡∂ß", translit: "√¶thulata", en: "inside" }
pronunciation_tips: |
  ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∑î‡∂´‡∑è‡∂ö‡∂ª = ka-ru-nƒÅ-kar (four syllables).  
  ‡∑É‡∂∏‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂± = sa-mƒÅ-wen-na (soft 'sa').  
  Sinhala politeness is about *tone* as much as words.
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: "Sinhala politeness focuses on respect and gentle tone.  
           Use **‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∑î‡∂´‡∑è‡∂ö‡∂ª** to make requests, **‡∑É‡∂∏‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±** to apologise or get attention, and **‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑í** to end politely."
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∑î‡∂´‡∑è‡∂ö‡∂ª, ‡∂á‡∂≠‡∑î‡∑Ö‡∂ß ‡∂ë‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±. ‚Äî Please, come inside.  
      B: ‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑í! ‚Äî Thank you!  
      C: ‡∑É‡∂∏‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±, ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∂∂‡∑ë. ‚Äî Sorry, I can‚Äôt.
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: "Read the dialogue in polite tone. Make your own using 'please' and 'sorry'."
unlock_next: "lesson-05"

id: lesson-02
title: "Ask & Answer ‚Äî How are you?"
duration_min: 10
xp_reward: 12
objectives:
  - Ask and answer ‚ÄúHow are you?‚Äù
  - Use extra replies for different feelings
  - Practise natural short exchanges
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø", translit: "kohomada", en: "how?" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ß ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø?", translit: "oyƒÅta kohomada?", en: "How are you?" }
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂∫‡∑í", translit: "mama hondayi", en: "I‚Äôm fine" }
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑É‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑ù‡∑Ç‡∂∫‡∑í", translit: "mama santh≈çshayi", en: "I‚Äôm happy" }
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∂Ø‡∑î‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∂∫‡∑í", translit: "mama dukthayi", en: "I‚Äôm sad / tired" }
  - { si: "‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥ ‡∂±‡∑ê‡∑Ñ‡∑ê", translit: "mama honda n√¶h√¶", en: "I‚Äôm not well" }
pronunciation_tips: |
  ‡∂Ø‡∑î‡∂ö‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∂∫‡∑í = dukh-thai (like ‚Äúduk-tai‚Äù).  
  ‡∂±‡∑ê‡∑Ñ‡∑ê = n√¶-h√¶ ‚Äî short ‚Äú√¶‚Äù sound.
content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: "Sinhala ‚ÄòHow are you?‚Äô is **‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ß ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø?** ‚Äî literally 'To you, how?'.  
           Answers often skip verbs ‚Äî just feelings or adjectives."
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ß ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø? ‚Äî How are you?  
      B: ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂∫‡∑í! ‚Äî I‚Äôm fine!  
      A: ‡∂î‡∑Ä‡∑ä, ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑É‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑ù‡∑Ç‡∂∫‡∑í. ‚Äî Yes, I‚Äôm happy.  
      B: ‡∂±‡∑ë, ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥ ‡∂±‡∑ê‡∑Ñ‡∑ê. ‚Äî No, I‚Äôm not well.
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: "Say the question and answer with different emotions. Try swapping roles fast."
unlock_next: "lesson-03"

id: lesson-05
title: "Farewells & Small Talk"
duration_min: 12
xp_reward: 14
objectives:
  - "Use morning/night greetings and farewells"
  - "End short conversations naturally"
  - "Recognise tone differences (casual vs polite)"
vocab:
  - { si: "‡∑É‡∑î‡∂∑ ‡∂ã‡∂Ø‡∑ö‡∂ö‡∑ä", translit: "suba udek", en: "good morning" }
  - { si: "‡∑É‡∑î‡∂∑ ‡∂ª‡∑è‡∂≠‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂ö‡∑ä", translit: "suba rƒÅtriyak", en: "good night" }
  - { si: "‡∂∂‡∑è‡∂∫‡∑í", translit: "bƒÅyi", en: "bye (casual)" }
  - { si: "‡∂ú‡∂∏‡∂±‡∑ä ‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±", translit: "gaman yanna", en: "goodbye (formal)" }
  - { si: "‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ß ‡∑Ñ‡∂∏‡∑î‡∑Ä‡∑ì‡∂∏ ‡∑É‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂ß‡∂ö‡∑ä", translit: "oyƒÅta hamuwƒ´ma sathutak", en: "nice to meet you" }

pronunciation_tips: |
  ‡∑É‡∑î‡∂∑ ‚âà soo-bah.  
  ‡∂ã‡∂Ø‡∑ö‡∂ö‡∑ä = oo-dayk (soft ‚Äòk‚Äô).  
  ‡∂∂‡∑è‡∂∫‡∑í ‚âà bye (like English).  
  Use a smile with '‡∑É‡∑î‡∂∑ ‡∂ã‡∂Ø‡∑ö‡∂ö‡∑ä' ‚Äî it‚Äôs part of the culture.

content_blocks:
  - type: "CONCEPT"
    body: "Greetings shift through the day. '‡∑É‡∑î‡∂∑ ‡∂ã‡∂Ø‡∑ö‡∂ö‡∑ä' for morning, '‡∑É‡∑î‡∂∑ ‡∂ª‡∑è‡∂≠‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑í‡∂∫‡∂ö‡∑ä' for night. '‡∂∂‡∑è‡∂∫‡∑í' is casual, '‡∂ú‡∂∏‡∂±‡∑ä ‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±' is formal."
  - type: "DIALOGUE"
    body: |
      A: ‡∑É‡∑î‡∂∑ ‡∂ã‡∂Ø‡∑ö‡∂ö‡∑ä! ‡∂î‡∂∫‡∑è‡∂ß ‡∂ö‡∑ú‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∂Ø? ‚Äî suba udek! oyƒÅta kohomada? ‚Äî Good morning! How are you?  
      B: ‡∂∏‡∂∏ ‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂≥‡∂∫‡∑í, ‡∑É‡∑ä‡∂≠‡∑î‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∫‡∑í. ‚Äî mama hondayi, sthuthiyi. ‚Äî I‚Äôm fine, thank you.  
      A: ‡∂∂‡∑è‡∂∫‡∑í! ‚Äî bƒÅyi! ‚Äî Bye!  
      B: ‡∂ú‡∂∏‡∂±‡∑ä ‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑ä‡∂±! ‚Äî gaman yanna! ‚Äî Goodbye!
  - type: "PRACTICE"
    body: "Speak the greetings aloud. Pair casual and formal farewells correctly."
unlock_next: null
